meaningMnemonic: When you ride your <radical>scooter</radical>, you always carry an ink <radical>brush</radical> and some <radical>water</radical>. The water is to stay hydrated, obviously, and the brush is to write tickets for the criminals you <kanji>apprehend</kanji>. Why apprehend? I guess you're some kind of thirsty, scooter-riding cop who writes tickets in calligraphy. By the way, the shape of this brush (肀) is a little different from usual, but it's still a brush!
readingMnemonic: When you do catch up and <kanji>apprehend</kanji> someone, you always tie them down with the <reading>tie</reading> (たい) from your neck.
